sentence: 1 |||  ||| 0.1 ||| OBJECTIVE: To determine the efficacy of oral misoprostol (50 µg) administered every 3 hours compared to vaginal misoprostol (50 µg) administered every 6 hours for induction of labor.
content: the efficacy of oral misoprostol (50 µg) administered every 3 hours compared to vaginal misoprostol (50 µg) administered every 6 hours for induction of labor
label: pr.Disease

sentence: 13 ||| Material and methods ||| 1.5 ||| Post-term inductions were considered when gestational age was ≥41 weeks (41 0 weeks).
label: po.SS

sentence: 40 ||| Results ||| 2.1 ||| There were 126 patients enrolled in this study, 62 in the oral group and 64 in the vaginal group.
label: po.Size

sentence: 15 ||| Material and methods ||| 1.7 ||| Specific exclusion criteria included oligohydramnios (amniotic fluid index, <2.5th percentile for gestational age), 14 intrauterine growth restriction (estimated fetal weight, <10th percentile for gestational age), abruptio placenta, premature rupture of the membranes, previous uterine scar, prior PG use for cervical ripening/labor induction, and any contraindication to vaginal delivery (eg, active genital herpes).
content: exclusion criteria included oligohydramnios (amniotic fluid index, <2.5th percentile for gestational age), 14 intrauterine growth restriction (estimated fetal weight, <10th percentile for gestational age), abruptio placenta, premature rupture of the membranes, previous uterine scar, prior PG use for cervical ripening/labor induction, and any contraindication to vaginal delivery (eg, active genital herpes)
label: po.Disease

sentence: 2 |||  ||| 0.2 ||| STUDY METHODS: In this double-blind randomized trial, 126 women received misoprostol (50 µg) either orally every 3 hours or vaginally every 6 hours for induction of labor.
label: po.Gender

sentence: 2 |||  ||| 0.2 ||| STUDY METHODS: In this double-blind randomized trial, 126 women received misoprostol (50 µg) either orally every 3 hours or vaginally every 6 hours for induction of labor.
content: 126 women received misoprostol (50 µg) either orally every 3 hours or vaginally every 6 hours for induction of labor.

sentence: 18 ||| Material and methods ||| 1.10 ||| Each patient received an oral tablet every 3 hours and a vaginal tablet every 6 hours (administered concurrently with an oral tablet) to a maximum of 48 hours.
content: an oral tablet every 3 hours and a vaginal tablet every 6 hours
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 17 ||| Material and methods ||| 1.9 ||| Each envelope contained 2 packages of identically appearing pills, 1 labeled oral medication (either placebo or misoprostol, 50 µg) and 1 labeled vaginal medication (either placebo or misoprostol, 50 µg).
content: 2 packages of identically appearing pills, 1 labeled oral medication (either placebo or misoprostol, 50 µg) and 1 labeled vaginal medication (either placebo or misoprostol, 50 µg)
label: i.Procedure

sentence: 29 ||| Material and methods ||| 1.21 ||| As per our center's usual protocol for cervical ripening, those women not in labor at 48 hours were reassessed and their Bishop score repeated.
label: i.Diagnostic

sentence: 4 |||  ||| 0.4 ||| RESULTS: Median time to delivery was shorter in those women who were receiving vaginal misoprostol (vaginal 14.3 hours vs oral 23.1 hours; P = .0004) and more women in the oral group required oxytocin augmentation of labor (73% vs 42%)(RR, 1.98; 95% CI, 1.29 to 3.06).
content: Median time to delivery was shorter in those women who were receiving vaginal misoprostol
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 7 |||  ||| 0.7 ||| CONCLUSION: Vaginal misoprostol administered every 6 hours is more effective for induction of labor than oral misoprostol administered every 3 hours.
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 54 ||| Results ||| 2.15 ||| When comparing the groups with respect to intrapartum complications, there was an increased rate of tachysystole in those women receiving vaginal misoprostol.
label: o.Treatment

sentence: 79 ||| Results ||| 2.40 ||| Oral misoprostol has several potential advantages compared to vaginal misoprostol, including ease of administration and avoidance of repeated vaginal examinations.
label: o.Treatment
